title: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
description: Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)
OB: When following the steps in 1GEWMOZ, which involve creating a new basic project and a new file named test.xml, the scripted resource editor example is used as the default editor for XML files. If you select test.xml in the Navigator and choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor', nothing happens. The existing scripted resource editor example remains active and does not switch to the default text editor.
EB: When following the steps in 1GEWMOZ, selecting a file in the Navigator and choosing 'Open With... / Default Text Editor' should open a new editor for the file, even if it is already open. The new editor should be the default text editor because the file type is different. Currently, selecting 'Open With... / Default Text Editor' does not cause any action, and the existing editor remains active.
SR:
1. Create a new basic project
2. Create a new file named test.xml
3. The scripted resource editor example should be the default editor for XML files
4. In the Navigator, select test.xml
5. Choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor'
6. Verify that a new editor for the file opens and that it is the default text editor

NOTES: Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types. The expected behavior is for a new editor to open on the file, even if it is already open, and the type of editor should match the file type.
